discussion.title: Trouble using Symbolic Regression with Dimensional Constraints
discussion.body:
I was trying to follow the example code that uses dimensional constraints on the website - [Astro Automata](https://astroautomata.com/PySR/examples/#10-dimensional-constraints) - but it seems to break down when I keep the 'X_units' and 'y_units' part in the model.fit part - 
```
model.fit(
    X,
    y,
    X_units=["Constants.M_sun", "kg", "Constants.R_earth"],
    y_units=["kg * m / s^2"]
)
```
It does seem to work when I comment them out and SR does give me the $\frac{Mm}{r^2}$ relation but I'm having trouble constraining it. Not sure what I'm doing wrong or if I'm missing something.

nodes.body: Hm, what is the error message you are seeing?
Thanks for posting the error. As a temporary workaround, you can fix this by upgrading to Julia 1.10, where this error will no longer occur. I’ll see if I can get this working on the older Julia too…
